definitions.definition: be in charge of (a company, establishment, or undertaking); administer; run.
examples: their elder son managed the farm
synonyms: be at the helm of; informalhead up "she manages a staff of 80 people"

definitions.definition: administer and regulate (resources under one's control).
examples: we manage our cash extremely well

definitions.definition: have the position of supervising (staff) at work.
examples: the skills needed to manage a young, dynamic team

definitions.definition: be the manager of (a sports team or a performer).
examples: he managed five or six bands in his career
synonyms: be at the helm of; informalhead up "she manages a staff of 80 people"

definitions.definition: maintain control or influence over (a person or animal).
examples: she manages horses better than anyone I know
synonyms: deal with "she can't manage that horse"

definitions.definition: control the use or exploitation of (land).
examples: the forest is managed to achieve maximum growth

definitions.definition: succeed in surviving or in attaining one's aims, especially against heavy odds; cope.
examples: Catherine managed on five hours' sleep a night
synonyms: hack it "will you be able to manage without him?"

definitions.definition: succeed in doing, achieving, or producing (something, especially something difficult).
examples: she managed a brave but unconvincing smile

definitions.definition: succeed in dealing with or withstanding (something).
examples: there was more stress and anxiety than he could manage
synonyms: deal with "she can't manage that horse"

definitions.definition: be free to attend on (a certain day) or at (a certain time).
examples: he could not manage March 24 after all
